subject: Programming
title: Empathy in Software Design
description: A quick, practical guide to Empathy in Software Design.

hook.text: The best software isn't built by the smartest engineers. It's built by those who understand users.

buildup.text: Empathy means understanding what users feel, fear, and need ‚Äî not just what they click.

discovery.text: Empathetic developers build error messages that help, flows that forgive, and defaults that make sense.

twist.text: Technical people often optimize for edge cases and forget that 90% of users follow the happy path.

climax.text: User research, accessibility, and inclusive design are all empathy translated into engineering practice.

punchline.text: Build for humans, not for specifications.

quiz.question: Why is empathy important in software design?
options: It helps build software that truly serves users
It makes the code compile faster
It reduces the number of code lines
